label: 伴造
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: royal vassals of the Great King who generally resided in the countryside and performed various types of service for the Yamato ruler. Frequently, tomo-no-miyatsuko oversaw the activities of worker groups, or be, that served the throne in a wide variety of capacities. They often held such titles as obito and muraji. [部、首、連]
